Posts.Content: curleygirly wrote: Hey everyone, I have had a bruise-like pain near my hairline on the front of my head for almost 3 months, no injury. My question is for those who have had these. Can you please describe the symptoms you felt? Did you experience anything like I described? Thanks so much guys xox Dx 2/14/2014, IDC, Right, 3cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- (IHC) Hormonal Therapy 3/13/2014 Zoladex (goserelin) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain on head worried about possible skull mets curleygirly curleygirly

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2017 09:51AM curleygirly wrote: Sorry for being so late with my follow up response :( As it turned out I indeed have skull mets, about 5 of them. I was recently hospitalized because of severe pain from progression. I had some radiation done on the back of the head so I could lay down without pain. Worked like a charm!! Now I have a, what I am calling "lopsided unicorn horn", "devil horn", growing out of my forehead near my hairline. Onc does not know what it is so hoping the upcoming scans will help figure out what it is!! Oh this cancertrain, please let me off!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Pain on head worried about possible skull mets curleygirly curleygirly
Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2016 01:30AM curleygirly wrote: Thanks Pajim I guess I am feeling really restless and just do not know how to fully deal with this, still, even after 3 years. The waiting and seeing, the never knowing,the constant questions it is quite maddening!!! I will try my best to stay in the now and be thankful to see another day!
Posts.Title: a little lost curleygirly curleygirly

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2016 01:31AM curleygirly wrote: It really does help to know I am not alone!! Hugs right back!!! :)
Posts.Title: a little lost curleygirly curleygirly

Posts.Content: curleygirly wrote: I have a question. For my 38th birthday I was dx de novo MBC almost 3 years ago. I only have mets to lymph and bones right now. My treatment started with hormone therapy and I quickly went through 3 different kinds. I did a course of A/C treatment and the cancer progressed within 10 mths. I am lucky to still have my primary tumor, which has been biopsied again. My cancer has become endocrine resistant.I am starting paclitaxel next week. I feel lucky in some ways but also feel that I am going through treatments quickly. I guess I am hoping to know...I need to know, from all of you ladies, am I in a good spot? What are your opinions on my outlook, prognosis?! Any guidance would be much appreciated. I am driving myself crazy with googling and Docs always give the same answers,wait and see, but given the massive experience within this group, I was hoping for a little more! Thank you all in advance! Fight on lifers!!! Dx 2/14/2014, IDC, Right, 3cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- (IHC) Hormonal Therapy 3/13/2014 Zoladex (goserelin) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: a little lost curleygirly curleygirly

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2014 05:54PM curleygirly wrote: Thank you all for welcoming me!  I have read through a few threads and feel better knowing there is a group of amazing strong women who know what this feels like.  I have already been uplifted by words written by you ladies.  I will try ignore the giant clock counting down over my head and start living outside the fog that had surrounded me since my diagnosis
Posts.Title: From a lump to stage 4 within a month! What now ....... curleygirly Mompsych

Posts.Content: curleygirly wrote: About a month ago I felt a significant lump in my breast and 4 weeks later, for my 39th birthday, I received the worst news I have ever had!  Stage 4 breast cancer, I can think of better things to get on your birthday.  I have IDC with mets to nodes and bones, still waiting for HER2 results.  No surgery, chemo or radiation, hormonal and bone meds only.   I am a mother of 2 children, a husband I am crazy about and a job I love. Since my diagnosis I have not returned to work and feel confused ,angry and sad, I guess my question is, what now........ Dx 2/14/2014, IDC, Right, 3cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- (IHC) Hormonal Therapy 3/14/2014 Zoladex (goserelin) Log in to post a reply
